edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math

Class MathTools

  • java.lang.Object
    • edu.gatech.cs2340.trydent.math.MathTools

  • public class MathTools
extends java.lang.Object
    Library of advanced math tools, primarily linear algebra.

    To be used by advanced developers only.

    • Method Detail

      • wrapAngle

        public static double wrapAngle(double theta)
        Takes an angle in degrees and wraps it to the range 0 - 360.
        Parameters:
        theta - angle in degrees to wrap if necessary
        Returns:
        the wrapped angle in degrees (between 0 and 360)

      • degreeLerp

        public static double degreeLerp(double thetaA,
                                double thetaB,
                                double t)
        Performs a linear interpolation from the first angle to the second at time t, going either clockwise or counter-clockwise depending on which distance is shorter.
        Parameters:
        thetaA - starting angle (at t=0)
        thetaB - ending angle (at t=1)
        t - interpolation parameter, where t=0 returns thetaA, and t=1 returns thetaB.
        Returns:
        the interpolated angle, wrapped to be between 0 and 360.

      • bezier

        public static <T extends BaseVector<?>> T bezier(double t,
                                                 T... points)
        Performs an (n-1) dimensional Bezier interpolation over n points. (Advanced functionality).
        Type Parameters:
        T - type of point
        Parameters:
        t - interpolation parameter - t=0.0 will return the 1st point, t=1.0 will return the last point.
        points - One or more points to interpolate between.
        Returns:
        the interpolated point

      • lerp

        public static <T extends BaseVector<?>> T lerp(double a,
                                               T start,
                                               double b,
                                               T end,
                                               double t)
        Modified lerp that passes through point 'start' at time t=a and point 'end' at time t=b. (Advanced functionality).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the point to interpolate (inferred from other arguments)
        Parameters:
        a - starting time
        start - starting point
        b - ending time
        end - ending point
        t - interpolation parameter time
        Returns:
        interpolated point at time t

      • lerp

        public static <T extends BaseVector<?>> T lerp(T start,
                                               T end,
                                               double t)
        Linear interpolation from start to end at time t. (Advanced functionality).
        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the point to interpolate (inferred from the other arguments)
        Parameters:
        start - start point at t=0
        end - end point at t=1
        t - interpolation parameter
        Returns:
        interpolated point

      • hermite

        public static double hermite(double p0,
                             double t0,
                             double p1,
                             double t1,
                             double t)
        Scalar hermite interpolation. (Advanced functionality).

        P(t) = (2t^3-3t^2+1)P0+(t^3-2t^2+t)T0+(-2t^3+3t^2)P1+(t^3-t^2)T1

        Parameters:
        p0 - first point
        t0 - first tangent
        p1 - second point
        t1 - second tangent
        t - interpolation parameter (P(t=0) = p0, P(t=1) = p1)
        Returns:
        interpolated floating point value

      • hermite

        public static <T extends BaseVector<?>> T hermite(T p0,
                                                  BaseVector<?> t0,
                                                  T p1,
                                                  BaseVector<?> t1,
                                                  double t)
        Vector hermite interpolation. (Advanced functionality).

        P(t) = (2t^3-3t^2+1)P0+(t^3-2t^2+t)T0+(-2t^3+3t^2)P1+(t^3-t^2)T1

        Type Parameters:
        T - the type of the point to interpolate (inferred from the other arguments)
        Parameters:
        p0 - first point
        t0 - first tangent
        p1 - second point
        t1 - second tangent
        t - interpolation parameter (P(t=0) = p0, P(t=1) = p1)
        Returns:
        interpolated point

        Returns:
